verses.kjv: And when the queen of Sheba heard of the fame of Solomon concerning the name of the LORD, she came to prove him with hard questions.
verses.web: When the queen of Sheba heard of the fame of Solomon concerning LORD’s name, she came to test him with hard questions.
verses.ct: When the queen of Sheba heard about Solomon's fame and his connection to the LORD, she traveled to Jerusalem to test him with difficult questions.

verses.kjv: And she came to Jerusalem with a very great train, with camels that bare spices, and very much gold, and precious stones: and when she was come to Solomon, she communed with him of all that was in her heart.
verses.web: She came to Jerusalem with a very great caravan, with camels that bore spices, very much gold, and precious stones; and when she had come to Solomon, she talked with him about all that was in her heart.
verses.ct: She arrived in Jerusalem with an enormous caravan — camels loaded with spices, a huge amount of gold, and precious stones. When she met with Solomon, she talked with him about everything on her mind.

verses.kjv: And Solomon told her all her questions: there was not any thing hid from the king, which he told her not.
verses.web: Solomon answered all her questions. There wasn’t anything hidden from the king which he didn’t tell her.
verses.ct: Solomon answered every one of her questions. Nothing was too complex for the king; he explained it all to her.

verses.kjv: And when the queen of Sheba had seen all Solomon’s wisdom, and the house that he had built,
verses.web: When the queen of Sheba had seen all the wisdom of Solomon, the house that he had built,
verses.ct: When the queen of Sheba had witnessed Solomon's wisdom firsthand, seen the palace he had built,

verses.kjv: And the meat of his table, and the sitting of his servants, and the attendance of his ministers, and their apparel, and his cupbearers, and his ascent by which he went up unto the house of the LORD; there was no more spirit in her.
verses.web: the food of his table, the sitting of his servants, the attendance of his officials, their clothing, his cup bearers, and his ascent by which he went up to LORD’s house; there was no more spirit in her.
verses.ct: the food served at his table, the seating arrangements for his officials, the way his attendants carried out their duties, their fine clothing, his cupbearers, and the stairway he used to go up to the LORD's temple — she was completely overwhelmed.

verses.kjv: And she said to the king, It was a true report that I heard in mine own land of thy acts and of thy wisdom.
verses.web: She said to the king, “It was a true report that I heard in my own land of your acts, and of your wisdom.
verses.ct: She told the king, "Everything I heard back in my own country about your accomplishments and your wisdom was true.

verses.kjv: Howbeit I believed not the words, until I came, and mine eyes had seen it: and, behold, the half was not told me: thy wisdom and prosperity exceedeth the fame which I heard.
verses.web: However I didn’t believe the words until I came and my eyes had seen it. Behold, not even half was told me! Your wisdom and prosperity exceed the fame which I heard.
verses.ct: I didn't believe any of it until I came and saw it with my own eyes. And honestly, I wasn't even told half of it! Your wisdom and wealth far surpass the reports I heard."

verses.kjv: Happy are thy men, happy are these thy servants, which stand continually before thee, and that hear thy wisdom.
verses.web: Happy are your men, happy are these your servants, who stand continually before you, who hear your wisdom.
verses.ct: "How fortunate your people are! How fortunate these servants of yours who stand in your presence day after day and get to hear your wisdom!

verses.kjv: Blessed be the LORD thy God, which delighted in thee, to set thee on the throne of Israel: because the LORD loved Israel for ever, therefore made he thee king, to do judgment and justice.
verses.web: Blessed is LORD your God, who delighted in you, to set you on the throne of Israel. Because LORD loved Israel forever, therefore he made you king, to do justice and righteousness.”
verses.ct: Blessed be the LORD your God, who was so pleased with you that he placed you on the throne of Israel. Because the LORD loves Israel with an everlasting love, he made you king to carry out justice and righteousness."

verses.kjv: And she gave the king an hundred and twenty talents of gold, and of spices very great store, and precious stones: there came no more such abundance of spices as these which the queen of Sheba gave to king Solomon.
verses.web: She gave the king one hundred twenty talents of gold, and a very great quantity of spices, and precious stones. Never again was there such an abundance of spices as these which the queen of Sheba gave to king Solomon.
verses.ct: Then she gave the king 120 talents of gold, an enormous quantity of spices, and precious stones. Never again did such an abundance of spices arrive in Israel as what the queen of Sheba gave to King Solomon.

verses.kjv: And the navy also of Hiram, that brought gold from Ophir, brought in from Ophir great plenty of almug trees, and precious stones.
verses.web: The fleet of Hiram that brought gold from Ophir, also brought in from Ophir great quantities of almug trees and precious stones.
verses.ct: Hiram's fleet, which carried gold from Ophir, also brought back large quantities of almug wood and precious stones from there.

verses.kjv: And the king made of the almug trees pillars for the house of the LORD, and for the king’s house, harps also and psalteries for singers: there came no such almug trees, nor were seen unto this day.
verses.web: The king made of the almug trees pillars for LORD’s house, and for the king’s house, harps also and stringed instruments for the singers; no such almug trees came or were seen, to this day.
verses.ct: The king used the almug wood to make supports for the LORD's temple and for the royal palace, as well as harps and lyres for the musicians. No almug wood like that has ever been imported or seen since that day.

verses.kjv: And king Solomon gave unto the queen of Sheba all her desire, whatsoever she asked, beside that which Solomon gave her of his royal bounty. So she turned and went to her own country, she and her servants.
verses.web: King Solomon gave to the queen of Sheba all her desire, whatever she asked, in addition to that which Solomon gave her of his royal bounty. So she turned and went to her own land, she and her servants.
verses.ct: King Solomon gave the queen of Sheba everything she wanted and asked for, on top of the gifts he gave her from his own royal generosity. Then she and her servants left and returned to her own country.

verses.kjv: Now the weight of gold that came to Solomon in one year was six hundred threescore and six talents of gold,
verses.web: Now the weight of gold that came to Solomon in one year was six hundred sixty-six talents of gold,
verses.ct: The weight of gold that came to Solomon in a single year totaled 666 talents of gold,

verses.kjv: Beside that he had of the merchantmen, and of the traffick of the spice merchants, and of all the kings of Arabia, and of the governors of the country.
verses.web: in addition to that which the traders brought, and the traffic of the merchants, and of all the kings of the mixed people, and of the governors of the country.
verses.ct: not counting the revenue from merchants and traders, the tribute from all the kings of Arabia, and the taxes from the governors throughout the land.

verses.kjv: And king Solomon made two hundred targets of beaten gold: six hundred shekels of gold went to one target.
verses.web: King Solomon made two hundred bucklers of beaten gold; six hundred shekels of gold went to one buckler.
verses.ct: King Solomon made 200 large shields of hammered gold, using 600 shekels of gold for each shield.

verses.kjv: And he made three hundred shields of beaten gold; three pound of gold went to one shield: and the king put them in the house of the forest of Lebanon.
verses.web: he made three hundred shields of beaten gold; three minas of gold went to one shield; and the king put them in the House of the Forest of Lebanon.
verses.ct: He also made 300 smaller shields of hammered gold, using 3 minas of gold for each one. The king placed them in the House of the Forest of Lebanon.

verses.kjv: Moreover the king made a great throne of ivory, and overlaid it with the best gold.
verses.web: Moreover the king made a great throne of ivory, and overlaid it with the finest gold.
verses.ct: The king also built a magnificent throne made of ivory and covered it with the finest gold.

verses.kjv: The throne had six steps, and the top of the throne was round behind: and there were stays on either side on the place of the seat, and two lions stood beside the stays.
verses.web: There were six steps to the throne, and the top of the throne was round behind; and there were armrests on either side by the place of the seat, and two lions standing beside the armrests.
verses.ct: The throne had 6 steps leading up to it, and the back of the throne was rounded at the top. There were armrests on both sides of the seat, with a lion standing beside each armrest.

verses.kjv: And twelve lions stood there on the one side and on the other upon the six steps: there was not the like made in any kingdom.
verses.web: Twelve lions stood there on the one side and on the other on the six steps. Nothing like it was made in any kingdom.
verses.ct: 12 lions stood along the 6 steps, one on each side of every step. Nothing like it had ever been made for any kingdom in the world.

verses.kjv: And all king Solomon’s drinking vessels were of gold, and all the vessels of the house of the forest of Lebanon were of pure gold; none were of silver: it was nothing accounted of in the days of Solomon.
verses.web: All king Solomon’s drinking vessels were of gold, and all the vessels of the House of the Forest of Lebanon were of pure gold. None were of silver, because it was considered of little value in the days of Solomon.
verses.ct: All of King Solomon's drinking cups were made of gold, and every piece in the House of the Forest of Lebanon was pure gold. Not a single item was made of silver — silver was considered practically worthless in Solomon's time.

verses.kjv: For the king had at sea a navy of Tharshish with the navy of Hiram: once in three years came the navy of Tharshish, bringing gold, and silver, ivory, and apes, and peacocks.
verses.web: For the king had a fleet of Tarshish at sea with Hiram’s fleet. Once every three years the fleet of Tarshish came, bringing gold, silver, ivory, apes, and peacocks.
verses.ct: The king had a fleet of trading ships at sea alongside Hiram's fleet. Once every 3 years, the ships of Tarshish would return carrying gold, silver, ivory, apes, and peacocks.

verses.kjv: So king Solomon exceeded all the kings of the earth for riches and for wisdom.
verses.web: So king Solomon exceeded all the kings of the earth in riches and in wisdom.
verses.ct: King Solomon surpassed every other king on earth in both wealth and wisdom.

verses.kjv: And all the earth sought to Solomon, to hear his wisdom, which God had put in his heart.
verses.web: All the earth sought the presence of Solomon, to hear his wisdom, which God had put in his heart.
verses.ct: People from all over the world sought an audience with Solomon to hear the wisdom that God had placed in his heart.

verses.kjv: And they brought every man his present, vessels of silver, and vessels of gold, and garments, and armour, and spices, horses, and mules, a rate year by year.
verses.web: Year after year, every man brought his tribute, vessels of silver, vessels of gold, clothing, armor, spices, horses, and mules.
verses.ct: Year after year, each visitor brought gifts — silver and gold items, clothing, armor, spices, horses, and mules.

verses.kjv: And Solomon gathered together chariots and horsemen: and he had a thousand and four hundred chariots, and twelve thousand horsemen, whom he bestowed in the cities for chariots, and with the king at Jerusalem.
verses.web: Solomon gathered together chariots and horsemen. He had one thousand four hundred chariots, and twelve thousand horsemen, that he kept in the chariot cities and with the king at Jerusalem.
verses.ct: Solomon built up a massive force of chariots and horsemen. He had 1,400 chariots and 12,000 horsemen, which he stationed in the chariot cities and with him in Jerusalem.

verses.kjv: And the king made silver to be in Jerusalem as stones, and cedars made he to be as the sycomore trees that are in the vale, for abundance.
verses.web: The king made silver as common as stones in Jerusalem, and cedars as common as the sycamore trees that are in the lowland.
verses.ct: Under Solomon, silver became as common as stones in Jerusalem, and cedar wood was as plentiful as the sycamore trees in the lowlands.

verses.kjv: And Solomon had horses brought out of Egypt, and linen yarn: the king’s merchants received the linen yarn at a price.
verses.web: The horses which Solomon had were brought out of Egypt. The king’s merchants received them in droves, each drove at a price.
verses.ct: Solomon's horses were imported from Egypt. The king's merchants purchased them in large groups, each group at a set price.

verses.kjv: And a chariot came up and went out of Egypt for six hundred shekels of silver, and an horse for an hundred and fifty: and so for all the kings of the Hittites, and for the kings of Syria, did they bring them out by their means.
verses.web: A chariot came up and went out of Egypt for six hundred shekels of silver, and a horse for one hundred fifty shekels; and so they exported them to all the kings of the Hittites, and to the kings of Syria.
verses.ct: A chariot could be imported from Egypt for 600 shekels of silver, and a horse for 150 shekels. Solomon's merchants also exported them to the kings of the Hittites and the kings of Aram.
